subject: Investing
title: Dividend Aristocrats
description: A micro-lesson that makes Dividend Aristocrats usable.

hook.text: Procter & Gamble has raised its dividend every single year for over 65 yearsâ€”through wars, recessions, and pandemics.

buildup.text: Dividend Aristocrats are S&P 500 companies that have increased dividends for at least 25 consecutive years.

discovery.text: The discipline required to raise payouts for decades signals strong cash flow and conservative management.

twist.text: Aristocrats aren't immune to cuts. General Electric was once an aristocrat before slashing its dividend to a penny.

climax.text: Use the Aristocrat list as a starting point, then verify current financials before investing.

punchline.text: A 25-year streak isn't a guaranteeâ€”but it's one of the best filters in investing.

quiz.question: What qualifies a stock as a Dividend Aristocrat?
options: Increasing dividends for at least 25 consecutive years in the S&P 500
